body:
Okay, so there has been a lot of talk about DDOS recently on the TeamSpeak server. Some people have been talking about it in a joking fashion, however, some others have been using it as a threat and a form of harassment. I would like to announce that speaking of DDOS in the team speak can now be punishable since I have had multiple players come and talk to me about being scared or even quitting Avicus because of this. We don't want to be a hostile community but after giving this some thought, it has brought a negative impact and a stormy cloud onto the community iteself. We want to be a friendly community. This is now, frankly unacceptable. 

So to sum up, all threats about ddosing, ddosing itself, or "booting somebody off" is now forbidden in TeamSpeak unless you have some issues regarding possibly being ddosed yourself. The act of talking about this can result in a tempban of around 1 week or more depending on the severity of the situation. However ddosing itself will be a perm ban no question.

If i find users are evading these rules, action will be taken no matter who you are.

-tel

replies.body:
TeamSpeak is something where you can talk to people on. It's where some Avicus members talk while they play there games. You will find me in there quite a lot too if you want to talk to me about something. You have to download it from the interent first though.

DDOS is where someone sends you a bunch of information which can temporarily disable your internet or even perm disable it if it is that bad. But I can assure you that it wont happen.

replies.body: DDoS - Distributed Denial of Service Attack (DDoS) Definition. A denial of service (DoS) attack is a malicious attempt to make a server or a network resource unavailable to users, usually by temporarily interrupting or suspending the services of a host connected to the Internet. Types of DoS Attacks.
replies.body_tagged: DDoS - Distributed Denial of Service Attack (DDoS) Definition. A denial of service (DoS) attack is a malicious attempt to make a server or a network resource unavailable to users, usually by temporarily interrupting or suspending the services of a host connected to the Internet. Types of DoS Attacks.

replies.body:
A denial of service (DoS) attack is a malicious attempt to make a server or a network resource unavailable to users, usually by temporarily interrupting or suspending the services of a host connected to the Internet.

TeamSpeak is proprietary voice-over-Internet Protocol (VoIP) software that allows computer users to speak on a chat channel with fellow computer users, much like a telephone conference call. 

Google ^-^
